turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright. We have x^2 + y^2 = 100, where x is the distance from the wall and y is the height of the ladder on the wall. Now, differentiate both sides with respect to time (t). This gives us 2x(dx/dt) + 2y(dy/dt) = 0. We are given dx/dt = 1 ft/sec and we want to find dy/dt when x = 6 ft. When x = 6, y = 8 (using the Pythagorean theorem).  Can you try solving for dy/dt from here?
